title: Comcast and Charter are making a streaming box for self-loathing cord-cutters
content:
[Edit 3:30pm June 15: A Comcast representative writes to say that the Xumo Stream Box will only be offered to Charter and Comcast customers this year, while a Xumo TV (powered by the same Xumo-based OS) will be made available in retail locations. Ars regrets the error.

Original story follows.]

Consumers right now are faced with an overwhelming number of choices for watching streaming media on a TV. Most TVs have a system built in, often Roku, Google, or Samsung. Standalone boxes from Roku, Apple, Google, and Amazon rule the third-party market, and smaller vendors offer remarkably cheap Android-based boxes online and at discount retailers.
